The equal wisdom that severs the bonds is called following.

Question:

Using the undefiled path to cut off lower afflictions,
One then accomplishes the merits of the upper stages with outflows.

One also accomplishes the undefiled merits of the upper stages.

The question says:

The explanation says:
The wisdom of equality is the fruit of following.
It has no ability to treat the bonds of the non-conceptual stage at all, so there is no fruit of following.
Because there is no fruit to follow, it is purely called uncontaminated.
The distinction between contaminated and uncontaminated is like this.
Next, distinguishing between conditioned and unconditioned.
Precepts, concentration, wisdom, etc. are conditioned.
The merit of cessation is unconditioned.
If these two are distinguished in terms of the path of cessation, all conditioned merits are called stages.
Unconditioned merits are all classified as fruits.
If distinguished in terms of the four stages and four fruits,
the stages contain both conditioned and unconditioned.
The fruits are also the same.
A question is asked:
Since the stages already contain two kinds,
which conditioned and which unconditioned are the correct stages and which are not the correct stages?
There are two explanations:
First, distinguishing according to type.
The two kinds of stages, conditioned and unconditioned, each have their own correct meaning in relation to the two fruits, conditioned and unconditioned.
What are their characteristics?
The conditioned stages, in relation to the conditioned fruits, are mutually related and thus can be called correct.
Moreover, when reaching the fruition stage, one obtains the conditioned merits and virtues that existed in the causal stage.

Second, distinguishing between strong and weak.

The strong power is determined to be the right path.
The unconditioned lacks power and is determined to be the following path.
What is the meaning of this?
The conditioned factors in the causal stage have the power of cultivation that can give rise to the unconditioned merits and virtues in the fruition stage.
Therefore, it is called right.
Moreover, it can sever the bonds and lead to the unconditioned merits and virtues in the fruition stage.
Therefore, in relation to those virtues, it is also called right.
The unconditioned merits and virtues in the path of progress are called following.
Because it lacks the first two abilities, it is not called right.

Contemplating the suffering and impermanence, etc. of the non-conceptual stage.

Because the power of this mind's subtle investigation is weak,

They sever the bonds of the upper realms and head towards arhatship, which is categorized as two stages.
Or they use the uncontaminated [mind] generated in the future meditation, the first meditation, and the intermediate [meditation].
They sever the bonds of the upper realms, which is categorized as three stages.
Or they use the previous three and add the uncontaminated [mind] generated in the second meditation.
They sever the bonds of the upper realms, which is categorized as four stages.
Or they use the previous four and add the third meditation, which is categorized as five stages.

Adding the sphere of infinite space is categorized as seven stages.

How are they fully endowed?

First, the pure [dharmas] are mutually relied upon to accomplish the upper [stages] based on the lower [stages].

When eliminating the bonds of the first dhyÄna, one attains the pure merits of the second dhyÄna.
It is like this for all [stages].

There are people who, as ordinary beings, may attain the first dhyÄna up to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, and later attain the holy [path].
Having used the pure [dharmas] produced in any stage to eliminate the bonds of the upper [stages],

Third, in terms of the contaminated depending on the uncontaminated, the lower supports the higher.
For example, using the expedient cognition of the second dhyÄna to eliminate the bonds of the first dhyÄna, one then attains the uncontaminated merit of the second dhyÄna.

Fourth, in terms of the contaminated depending on the uncontaminated, the higher supports the lower.

Because they are cultivated together.

Up to the expedient cognition of the peak of existence is also able to counteract the bonds of the sphere of nothingness.
This is called cultivating together.
Because they are cultivated together, using that expedient cognition of the second dhyÄna,
when one eliminates the afflictions of the first dhyÄna,
one then attains the uncontaminated merit of the first dhyÄna.
Although one may obtain a small portion, it is not much.
One only obtains a small portion of the undefiled [dharmas] that counteract the bonds of the first dhyÄna.
The rest are all not obtained.
Therefore it is said to be a small portion.
How does one obtain it?
When the path of non-obstruction directly eliminates it,
the attainment of the undefiled [dharmas] should arise in the mind.
Up to using the expedient wisdom of the stage of neither perception nor non-perception,

Since one obtains the undefiled merit of the first dhyÄna stage through the expedient wisdom of those stages,ğŸ”½one obtains the same undefiled merit of the other stages that are the same in their counteraction.

The fundamental four dhyÄnas, the intermediate state, and the three formless [absorptions].

The four fruits of the four directions are roughly distinguished like this.

Including the previous thirteen.
